title: Implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/2470 of 20 December 20171, and all other
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Novel
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Novel 

Foods) (Amendment) Regulations 2024. 

(2) The Principal Regulations and these Regulations may be cited together 

as the European Union (Novel Foods) Regulations 2022 and 2024.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited european union (novel foods) (amendment) regulation 2024 (2) principal regulation regulation may cited together european union (novel foods) regulation 2022 2024

title: Implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/2470 of 20 December 20171, and all other
heading: In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the European
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations “Principal Regulations” means the European 

Union (Novel Foods) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 253 of 2022).
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean european union (novel foods) regulation 2022 (s.i no 253 2022)

title: Implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/2470 of 20 December 20171, and all other
heading: 3. Regulation 11 of the Principal Regulations is amended—
text_raw:
3. Regulation 11 of the Principal Regulations is amended— 

(a) 

in paragraph (6)(b), by inserting “and Regulation 12” after “the 
Official Controls Regulation”, and 

(b) by inserting after paragraph (7) the following paragraph: 

“(8) An authorised officer who serves a notice under paragraph 
(7) may, by further notice in writing to the recipient of the 
first notice, extend the period during which the removal of 
the food or relevant thing is prohibited for a further period 
specified in the second notice not exceeding 10 working 
days, provided that such extension is necessary for the 
purposes of completing analysis, testing or inspection of 
the food or relevant thing.”.
text_norm: 3 regulation 11 principal regulation amended-- (a) paragraph (6)(b) inserting regulation 12 official control regulation (b) inserting paragraph (7) following paragraph (8) authorised officer serf notice paragraph (7) may notice writing recipient first notice extend period removal food relevant thing prohibited period specified second notice exceeding 10 working day provided extension necessary purpose completing analysis testing inspection food relevant thing

title: Implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/2470 of 20 December 20171, and all other
heading: 4. Regulation 12 of the Principal Regulations is amended —
text_raw:
4. Regulation 12 of the Principal Regulations is amended — 

(a) 

in paragraph (1), by inserting “, provided that the second expert 
opinion is requested by notice in writing to the authorised 
officer within a period of 7 working days after the operator is 
notified of the results of the analysis, testing or inspection” after 
“(‘a second expert opinion’)”, 

(b) by inserting after paragraph (1) the following paragraphs: 

1 OJ No. L 351, 30.12.2017, p. 72. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 19th April, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [159] 3 

“(1A) Following receipt of a request pursuant to paragraph (1), 
a written 

authorised 

officer 

issue 

shall 

the 
acknowledgement of the request. 

(1B) An operator who makes a request pursuant to paragraph 
(1) shall provide to the authorised officer, in writing 
within 7 working days of the date of the acknowledgement 
issued pursuant to paragraph (1A), written details of the 
recognised and appropriately qualified expert who shall be 
giving the second expert opinion and a written list of 
documents and records relating to the sampling, analysis, 
or test required for the purpose of the documentary review 
under Article 35 of the Official Controls Regulation. 

(1C) The documentary review under Article 35 of the Official 
Controls Regulation shall be completed within 15 working 
days of the date on which the documents and records 
required for the purpose of the review are issued to the 
operator.”, 

(c) 

in paragraph (2), by substituting for subparagraph (i) the 
following: 

“when purchasing or taking the sample, and if so requested by 
the operator or the person in apparent charge or control of the 
food or relevant thing, ensure that a sufficient quantity is taken 
to allow for a second expert opinion referred to in Article 35(3) 
of the Official Controls Regulation, or”, and 

(d) by substituting for paragraph (4) the following: 

“(4) Where there is a dispute between the Authority or the 
official agency and the operator that is based on a second 
expert opinion, the operator may, by notice in writing 
delivered to the authorised officer no more than 10 
working days after the issuance of the opinion, request 
the Official Controls 
pursuant 
Regulation and at his or her own expense, a documentary 
review of the initial analysis or test or another analysis, 
test or inspection by another official laboratory.”. 

to Article 35(3) of

title: Implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/2470 of 20 December 20171, and all other
heading: 5. Regulation 13 of the Principal Regulations is amended—
text_raw:
5. Regulation 13 of the Principal Regulations is amended— 

(a) 

in paragraph (2)(a) by substituting “close and seal” for “seal and 
fasten”, 

(b) by inserting after paragraph (2) the following paragraph: 

“(2A) Notwithstanding paragraph (2)(a), an authorised officer 
may mark, close and seal a part of a sample, as 
appropriate, in the absence of the operator, or the person in 
apparent charge or control of the food, where no such 
person agrees to be present or it is not technically feasible 

 
 
 4 [159] 

for such person to be present during such marking, closing 
and sealing.”, 

(c) 

in paragraph (5), by inserting “, or the operator concerned 
availed of its right to a second expert opinion under Article 35 
of the Official Controls Regulation and Regulation 12” after “as 
specified in this Regulation”, and 

(d) by substituting for paragraph (7) the following: 

“(7) The Authority or the official agency, as the case may be, 
may, where it considers that it is necessary to eliminate or 
contain the risks to human, animal or plant health, animal 
welfare, or, as regards GMOs and plant protection 
products, also to the environment, take immediate action 
notwithstanding that the sampling procedures set out in 
this Regulation have not been carried out and 
notwithstanding any application by the operator for a 
second expert opinion under Article 35 of the Official 
Controls Regulation and Regulation 12.”.
text_norm: 5 regulation 13 principal regulation amended-- (a) paragraph (2)(a) substituting close seal seal fasten (b) inserting paragraph (2) following paragraph (2a) notwithstanding paragraph (2)(a) authorised officer may mark close seal part sample appropriate absence operator person apparent charge control food person agrees present technically feasible 4 159 person present marking closing sealing (c) paragraph (5) inserting operator concerned availed right second expert opinion article 35 official control regulation regulation 12 specified regulation (d) substituting paragraph (7) following (7) authority official agency case may may considers necessary eliminate contain risk human animal plant health animal welfare regard gmos plant protection product also environment take immediate action notwithstanding sampling procedure set regulation carried notwithstanding application operator second expert opinion article 35 official control regulation regulation 12

title: Implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/2470 of 20 December 20171, and all other
heading: 6. Regulation 14 of the Principal Regulations is amended—
text_raw:
6. Regulation 14 of the Principal Regulations is amended— 

(a) by substituting for subparagraph (2)(a) the following: 

“(a) 

in the presence of the operator, or the person in apparent 
charge or control of the relevant thing, mark, close and 
seal each relevant thing, copy or photograph, in such a 
manner as its nature will permit, and in such a way that the 
integrity of the sample is not compromised,”, 

(b) by inserting after paragraph (2) the following paragraph: 

“(2A) Notwithstanding paragraph (2)(a), an authorised officer 
may mark, close and seal a part of a sample, as 
appropriate, in the absence of the operator, or the person in 
apparent charge or control of the relevant thing, where no 
such person agrees to be present or it is not technically 
feasible for such person to be present during such 
marking, closing and sealing,”, 

(c) 

in paragraph (3), by inserting “, or the operator concerned 
availed of its right to a second expert opinion under Article 35 
of the Official Controls Regulation and Regulation 12,” after 
“taken pursuant to paragraph (1)”, and 

(d) by substituting for paragraph (5) the following: 

“(5) The Authority or the official agency, as the case may be, 
may, where it considers that it is necessary to eliminate or 
contain the risks to human, animal or plant health, animal 
welfare, or, as regards GMOs and plant protection 
products, also to the environment, take immediate action 
notwithstanding that the sampling procedures set out in 
this Regulation have not been carried out and 

 
 
 [159] 5 

notwithstanding any application by the operator for a 
second expert opinion under Article 35 of the Official 
Controls Regulation and Regulation 12.”.

title: Implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/2470 of 20 December 20171, and all other
heading: 7. Regulation 23 of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting
text_raw:
7. Regulation 23 of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting 

after paragraph (3) the following paragraphs: 

“(4) Calanus finmarchicus oil food supplements which were lawfully 
placed on the market before 12 July 2022 may be marketed until 
their date of minimum durability or use by date. 

(5) Calanus 

finmarchicus oil food supplements which were 
dispatched from a third country and were on their way to the 
Union before 12 July 2022 and complying with the rules in force 
before 12 July 2022, may be marketed until their date of 
minimum durability or use by date.”.

title: Implementing Regulation (EU) 2017/2470 of 20 December 20171, and all other
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations give further effect to Commission Implementing Regulation 
(EU) 2017/2470 of 20 December 2017 which establishes the Union List of 
Novel Foods as amended by the Commission Implementing Regulations 
specified in the Schedule to these Regulations. 

These Regulations amend the European Union (Novel Foods) Regulations 
2022 (S.I. No. 253 of 2022) in the manner specified in these Regulations. 

These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Novel Foods) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14 [159]
